description: By ellipsis from Latin [linea] abscissa, feminine of abscissus, perfect passive participle of abscindō (“cut off”). See abscind.

nouns.description: abscissa (plural abscissas or abscissae or abscissæ)

entries.meaning: (geometry) The first of the two terms by which a point is referred to, in a system of fixed rectilinear coordinate (Cartesian coordinate) axes.[First attested in the late 17th century.]
examples:
The point 
  
    
      
        (
        3
        ,
        2
        )
      
    
    {\displaystyle (3,2)}
  
 has 3 as its abscissa and 2 as its ordinate.

entries.meaning: (geometry) The horizontal line representing an axis of a Cartesian coordinate system, on which the abscissa (sense above) is shown.
